column2: Are there goals for a teams process (e.g. defect resolved in 24 hours)
Data is processed by hand (e.g. spreadsheets).
Does the team collect feedback from the customers of their code?
Data is available, but not widely available.
Does the team generate metrics to measure their performance?
Are metrics from static code analysis (see Testing & Verification) reported?
Are code quality reports generated on regular intervals?
Is code instrumented to provide operational metrics?
Does the team collect and process customer feedback?
Are reports visible to the entire team?
Are there a standard set of Key Process Indicators for the team?
Are data generate to follow the flow of work through  development, deployment and operations?
Is trending possible for the collected data?
Is customer usage of the application gathered and used to improve product outcomes?
Can artifacts be compared against prior versions?
Can release notes be generated from development artifacts?
Are reports visible to other teams in the organizational unit?
Does the team use graphing tools to generate reports in addition to tables or lists?
Can tests be chosen on a set of criteria to generate metrics only for those criteria?
Does the team use  trend analysis to spot issues before they become problems?

column1: Decision making based on detailed analysis
column2: Are team decisions made based on the results of detailed analysis of metrics and KPIs?
Does the team use automated data visualization tools?
Does the team compare results with other teams?

column1: Real-time data collection and analysis and reporting
column2: Are data collected, processed and reported in real-time?
Can team members perform ad-hoc analysis of data collected?
Can team members create custom views into the data?
Does the team compare results with other teams in the organization and the industry?
